pageContext.claim: “More than 300,000 people under Obama, 300,000 people left the workforce. Under just three years of by administration, 3.5 million people have joined the workforce and nobody believed that was possible.”
pageContext.analysis: This is misleading. Obama took office in the throes of a historic recession. Economic indicators were depressed during his first year and a half in office, generally speaking, before embarking on a growth spurt for the rest of Obama's eight-year term. More than 5 million people joined the U.S. labor force during Obama's presidency, according to Labor Department figures.
